Returns (Functions / Class Methods)

The return statements inside a function / class method are identified automatically, without the need for annotations. Annotations preceding return statements allow the return value to be specified in a human-readable way [not implemented].

annotation (Optional)

        ...
        //$ last action
        CODE
        //$ [return value]
        return xVar;
        ...

representation in the diagram

a) the return is in the main flow of actions


b) the return is inside a non-annotated IF-statement or loop.

[The arrow is dashed, curved and comes from the action that contains the return statement.]


In general, the return statements have zoom level 0.
